content.description:
This is a two pitch trad route and the first up the feature. It involves a low angle start, a bolted overhanging crux, and finally a beautiful, exposed headwall to the top.

P1. 5.11a. Climb up and right on low angle terrain with spacey gear. Gear improves as the terrain gets steeper, and eventually you get to a short, overhanging section followed by a fun, technical crux protected by 4 bolts. Finish on an obvious ledge with a two bolt anchor (150 feet).

P2. 5.11a. Climb beautiful cracks as they trend up and right to the ridge. Hands, fists, crimps, and technical footwork make for a sustained and engaging pitch on a beautiful face way off the deck. (65 feet)

Descent: walk straight off the back and down the gully to the west.
content.protection: A standard rack to #4 with doubles #0.5-#1, 4 bolts, and a bolted anchor atop P1.
content.location: Start in the middle of the feature on the left side of the big ramp 120 feet left of the lightning bolt, OW crack.
